posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Some clarifications are necessary for this old soul to venture much further into this one:
Hafen wrote:
3) Drow, that means elf. Subraces were removed lately, with gifts instead: +2 stat /+1ECL, +2 constitution /+0.5, Darkness 1/day +0.5, MR 32 +2 ECL, 10 000 gp +0.5ECL. I can pick up up to three of them
Define "ECL". In my own NWN vernacular, it means "Effective Character Level". If that is what you mean, I have no idea how it would impact the effectiveness of a build since ECL was abandoned by NWN with the expansions. If Arelith has implemented an ECL system similar to PnP you would need to detail it. I recommend using the Arelith PW section where someone has already started a thread that can be easily amended.

BTW, what is "MR 32"? Is this supposed to be spell resistance?

(Note: Unless you use abbreviations which are common to all areas of NWN game play, server-specific ones will need to be defined at least once in any discussion.)
5) I would like to have it focused on melee, but being able to bypass magic of opponents, or to counter it as much as possible, and bring them down. Fight with pure melee can be worse.
I perceive a few issues of bypassing magical defenses: DR penetration (requires a minimum enhancement which may or may not be available on all weapons), concealment (if you can't strip the enemy concealment, you will have big problems hitting), elemental buffer (means you may need to be selective in achieving some magic weapon enhancement, like divine or magic damage, for instance), damage shields (pretty much assures you will need some sort of stripping mechanism or use of range attack until recipro protection ends). Only the first few that occurred to me, though.

Bottom line is: list specifically what magic you would like to focus on bypassing. There are no "catch-all" builds, especially within 30 levels.
6) Weapon preference - I prefer elven style weapons like longsword, shortsword, rapier, scimitar. And dual wielding. But if neccesary i am willing to sacrifice it for better outcome.
I am inclined to build DevCrit vs. typically low Fort casters. In nonDevCrit environs, IKD vs. no/low Discipline types will also work well against casters.
9) Spellcasting -I wish to build up character using magic to counter spellcasters, protecting herself from magic of divine and arcane origin, buffing herself.

We got also "path of kensai" which makes character perma hasted. In return she cannot use any kind of magic, that means also any sort of potions, scrolls.

But i think this set up could be real hell for leveling up, as everywhere are mushrooms causing poisons on stats, etc. There would be no way how to rmove it if not monks levels were taken.
These two statements seem to contradict each other. Are you looking for a casting or non-casting remedy? Confusing.
Please, do not stack ECL above 3. It is hell with ECL2 to lvl up, even with multiclass penalty which this one will likely get (only cleric does not count for her for multiclassing).
Once again, I have no clue as to how this ECL deal would impact a build. If it just means it will more difficult to level certain class combos then get some party help until you have achieved your goal and then go dueling. If you want to duel effectively at all levels... well... there ain't no such animal! Builds are ALWAYS maximized for a particular level. That's just the way it works.

Based on the sketchiness of your request, I would guess a DevCrit battle cleric would serve well. IIRC there have already been a few Arelith battle clerics posted so check around the Level 30 section and decide what appeals and what doesn't. Any weapon that has wide crit range will suffice. Dual-wielding may not be an option depending on which classes you combine (fighter/cleric is probably the easiest to DW a Devcrit build).

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
That kensai choice seems lame to me. There are lots of ways to get around permahaste which, although being a boon if you can utilize it, isn't crucial to a build. All builds will benefit sufficiently enough from the use of general magic items that if it were removed, those builds would suffer a vast disadvantage, one that even permahaste would not compensate. My opinion, naturally.

Your concern about low damage is well-founded. As soon as you encounter any toon with Stoneskin, Ethereal Visage, etc. you won't do any damage except for crits... and kamas are one of the worst crit weapons, unfortunately. So lets get real clear on what you are trying to achieve, eh?

Your original request seemed to be focused on PvP caster-killing, right?

If so, I can't understand why you would go the DEX route since casters will not be trying to hit you with anything other than spells or damage shields so your AC can be relatively low. If you were going against uber AB foes, then DEX makes sense. You'll need more damage than this without DevCrit available. KD only last 1 round so unless you cause LOTS of damage while they are prone, they just heal/buff and resume casting. If they have recipro damage going, they can kill you while they are prone. If you stop spamming KD to use a range attack, the enemy will be able to cast.

BTW, maxing Discipline on a DEX build is pretty much a waste of skill points. AB of over 33 is rather easy to reach even on a level 30-cap server. I suggest limiting the skill investment only for strength builds (or those where strength can be boosted magically) where it will do some good. Besides, casters will not be trying to KD or disarm you.

Dispelling buffs is only one problem and it won't strip all defenses in one cast anyway. Level 14 caster is immune to Lesser dispel, level 19 caster immune to standard Dispel Magic. They will still be trying to spam IGMS or Bigby's or Harm... or some no-save spell. Depending on SR 30 to save you won't work against any Level 24 caster with Epic Spell pen (any d20 automatically beats the SR). Also, any arcanist can use an Iron Golem polymorph (either by casting or scroll) to avoid the few paltry sneaks thrown in here if they become a problem.

If you don't do significant damage while they are prone your toon will die pretty quickly. Ever consider Stunning Fist? At least that lasts 3 rounds and you could switch back an forth with kamas if you still want to dual-wield, but you'll need higher WIS to get the stuns to succeed often.

Perhaps some sort of monk/ranger if you can choose some effective FE's? But I can't help with your ECL calculations for combos. Another option might be to go the taunting route to reduce their casting effectiveness BEFORE attacking. That BG would help with a plan like that.

Dunno. IMO, either of the 2 builds posted should be rather easy for any decent caster to rule.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:How about unarmed Monk 24 / Fighter 6, with d20 damage, damage from STR and +6 damage from EWS? If +5 gloves aren't available, you can take the Improved Ki Strike feats to get +5. Since I know nothing about Arelith, this might not be a good idea.
Yeah, I would be inclined towards a high-speed closer type like this, ignoring stealth completely since they are likely to have True Seeing in place at all times anyway. My casters always do. Just concede detection and make it a foot race. Casters pale when confronted with real speed and will attempt to sanctuary to avoid melee range threats.

There is a documented speed exploit that the OP can try that involves Expeditious Retreat, Mass Haste & monk speed to close at incredible speeds. Also, a heavy investment into Initiative feats to get the first strike in as often as possible may sway the probabilities in one's favor. I would really look at stunning fist's 3 round neutralizer over KD's 1 round and plan to dispatch your foe within that duration with high damage (And yes, SF can be spammed like KD). Scythe is good for the lower APR rates but with monk APR & AB progression, those 3 rounds can be made very effective unarmed. Keep in mind that a concealed enemy will bypass most attacks so APR is key to assuring enough strikes land quickly.

Essentially, though DEX assures very high reflex saves, it is at the cost of any sort of reliable damage strategy and I have ALWAYS recommended offense over defense in PvP. As soon as you blink... you die!

As far as dealing with Hellball, Greater Ruin... those uber arcanist staples... they are 1 cast per day. Once avoided, the caster is dead meat vs. speed threats... usually.

Naturally, this discussion is more skewed towards PvP. A mob of duergar clerics spamming Implosion and Harm is an entirely different can of worms.
